caption.title: The effects of temperature and diurnal temperature range (DTR) on vectorial capacity.
caption.p: ( A) Increasing mean ambient temperature (27, 30 and 33 °C) and DTR of (0, 6, 9 °C) decreases the vectorial capacity of both Anopheles gambiae (grey bars) and An. stephensi (blue bars). ( B) When rate summation is used to estimate the predicted additional effects of DTR on biting rate and parasite development, the proportional reduction in vectorial capacity increases with mean ambient temperature and temperature variation. No predictions are available for An. gambiae at 33 °C as vectorial capacity is already zero without additional effects of DTR.
